alert.note: Alert for Starke (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 10:48PM EDT until April 01 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT/1015 PM CDT/ FOR NORTHEASTERN WHITE...FULTON...PULASKI... NORTHWESTERN CASS...SOUTHEASTERN STARKE AND SOUTHERN MARSHALL COUNTIES... At 1048 PM EDT/948 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Culver to 8 miles northeast of Winamac to 7 miles east of Monon, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Rochester, Winamac, Monon, Argos, Culver, Francesville, Royal Center, Pulaski, Walnut, Tippecanoe, Ripley, Kewanna, Fulton, Monterey, Leiters Ford, Beardstown, Nyena Lake, Leases Corner, Denham and Delong. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT/200 AM CDT/ for north central and northwestern Indiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
